name: More Essential Trivia Knowledge Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Glenn Miller received a golden disc for selling more than one million copies of which song title?
In which film did Charlie Chaplin play his first speaking part as Adenoid Hynkel?
The Titanic which was capable of holding about 3,500 people only had lifeboats for how many people?
When the super tanker Exxon Valdez ran aground in 1989 it was one of the worst environmental disasters ever in North American waters. Where was the captain when this happened?
questions.explanation:
Resting in his cabin.

	The ship ran aground while commanded by a junior officer.

questions.text: Which expressionist style of art based on extremely vivid non-naturalistic colours literally means 'Wild Beast'?
questions.explanation:
Fauvism.

	The leader of this group was Henri Matisse. A critic described their work as something produced by wild animals (fauves).

questions.text: In 1902 the Trans-Siberian Railway opened running from Moscow to Vladivostok. The largest railway in the world at the time stretched for how many miles?
When control of Hong Kong was passed back to China under an agreement signed in 1984, who of the following was NOT present at the farewell banquet?
questions.explanation:
John Major.

	Tony Blair was the British prime minister at the time not John Major.

questions.text: What was the profession of the 53 year old, Louis Washkansky, who was the patient of the world's first human heart transplant operation carried out by South African heart surgeon Dr. Christiaan Barnard?
Dutch athlete, Fanny Blankers-Koen, the star of the 1948 London Olympic Games won four gold medals but which of the following did the thirty year-old NOT triumph at?
questions.explanation:
Long Jump.

	She also helped the Dutch team to win the 4 x 100 metres relay.

questions.text: Which of the following was NOT on the sleeve of the Beatles' album 'Sergeant Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band'?
questions.explanation:
Elvis Presley.

	Hope you enjoyed the quiz.
